title: Compiler segfault when string literal too long
body:
by **jimteeuwen**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Try to compile the attached program.

What is the expected output?
The compiler should generate an error saying "[string too long]"

What do you see instead?
go build command-line-arguments: signal: segmentation fault (core dumped)

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
Linux 3.9.9-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Jul 3 22:45:16 CEST 2013 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.1.1 linux/amd64

Please provide any additional information below.
The compiler correctly gives the [string too long] error when defining the string value
as a `const`. It does not when defining it as a `var`.
Attachments: 1. segfault.go (40949 bytes)
